title: CNBC Daily Open: Higher manufacturing prices gave markets a bad start to March
description: Hawkish sentiment from Fed officials and higher manufacturing prices weighed on stocks and buoyed Treasury yields, giving markets a bad start to March.

title: Senate overturns federal rule on ESG investments, Biden vows to veto
description: President Joe Biden has said he plans to issue the first veto of his presidency.

title: A psychology expert shares the 7 toxic signs of 'highly insecure' people—and how to deal with them
description: Workplace psychology expert Stefan Falk has spent 30 years helping companies navigate difficult relationships. Through his research, the most challenging types of people tend to have insecure traits. Here's how to identify and deal with them.

title: Watch live: Biden speaks at House Democrats' conference as 2024 elections approach
description: The event allows House Democratic lawmakers to outline priorities for the new year and set a plan to try to retake the chamber after they lost power in 2022.

title: Salesforce shares jump 13% on better-than-expected forecast
description: Salesforce shares surged in extended trading on Wednesday on an optimistic earnings outlook.

title: The No. 1 reason women say they would quit their jobs in 2023
description: According to the latest Momentive/CNBC Women at Work Survey, more than half of women who are considering leaving their jobs are looking for higher pay.

title: TikTok's potential ban in U.S. could be boon for Meta and Snap
description: The U.S. House Foreign Affairs Committee on Tuesday took up legislation that would give President Joe Biden the authority to ban TikTok

title: Elon Musk is set to reveal 'Master Plan Part 3' at Tesla Investor Day after the bell
description: Tesla investors could get updates on an affordable electric vehicle, which CEO Elon Musk first teased in 2020, among other initiatives.

title: A year later, the Fed still has a long way to go in the fight against inflation
description: So after a year of inflation fighting, how are things going? In short, OK.

title: Rail unions tell Biden officials workers have fallen ill at Norfolk Southern derailment site
description: Leaders from 12 unions met with Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Amit Bose, administrator of the Federal Railroad Administration, in Washington.

title: David Einhorn says investors should be 'bearish on stocks and bullish on inflation'
description: Greenlight Capital's David Einhorn said Wednesday he's keeping his negative stance on the stock market as inflation and interest rates could shoot higher.

title: Photos show Venice’s canals running dry amid low tides
description: The situation in Venice comes after weeks of dry winter conditions have prompted fears that Italy will endure another drought.

title: How Trump allies and wealthy donors helped to fuel the GOP fight against ESG investing platforms
description: The GOP fight against ESG investing at firms like BlackRock has ties to allies of former President Trump, wealthy Republican donors and state treasurers.

title: Biden administration lawyer may have saved student loan forgiveness plan at Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court could rule within months on a $400 billion student loan forgiveness plan by the Biden administration.

title: Do you own a 'garbage-y' mutual fund? Here are the red flags to watch out for
description: High fees and poor performance are the hallmarks of a fund that doesn't belong in your portfolio.

title: Netflix announces a 'Stranger Things' stage play is coming to London's West End
description: The play joins a growing array of in-person events inspired by Netflix films and shows like "Bridgerton" and "Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery."

title: TikTok sets automatic one-hour screen time limit for teens
description: Teens will be able to opt out of the feature, but TikTok said that the app will prompt teens to set a limit if they spend "more than 100 minutes" on the app.

title: Activist investor Elliott nominates slate of directors to Salesforce board, sources say
description: Activist investor Elliott Management has nominated a slate of directors for Salesforce's board, sources told CNBC's David Faber.

title: Critical for Kazakhstan to pursue oil export options outside of Russia, investor says
description: Kazakhstan is exploring transport options for its oil, which currently transits and ships out of Russian territory, at risk of Moscow's disruptions.

title: The popularity of ChatGPT is a 'milestone' in establishing Qualcomm as an AI company, CEO says
description: The popularity of ChatGPT is a chance to show off the capabilities of artificial intelligence on smartphones, according to chip company Qualcomm's chief executive.

title: Stubborn inflation will remain at a very high level, German central bank president says
description: Joachim Nagel, president of Germany's Bundesbank, said that inflation is likely to remain high in the coming months.

title: Denmark to abolish springtime public holiday to help meet NATO spending goal
description: Danish lawmakers voted to abolish a springtime public holiday from the national calendar and plan to use the savings to boost military spending.

title: Motorola confirms a new foldable version of the iconic Razr smartphone is coming this year
description: Motorola revived the Razr brand in a new foldable form in 2020, becoming one of the first smartphone makers to launch a device with a bendable screen.

title: Brexit deal could resurface Britain's 'healthy fundamentals' if EU relations strengthen, analysts say
description: The new Brexit deal between the EU and the U.K. may help bring Britain's "healthy fundamentals" back to the fore.

title: Qualcomm CEO says he's expecting Apple to make its own iPhone modems from 2024
description: Cristiano Amon told CNBC Qualcomm has "no plans" to provide Apple with modem chips in 2024, but added it was "their decision to make."

title: Aston Martin shares surge 14% on profitability forecast for 2023
description: Shares of British luxury carmaker Aston Martin Lagonda surged, as the company's positive 2023 guidance offset pretax losses last year.

title: UK house prices post sharpest annual fall for a decade
description: U.K. house prices fell by 1.1% annually in February, their first annual decline since June 2020 and sharpest contraction since November 2012.

title: Nigerian ruling party candidate declared winner in highly disputed election
description: Nigeria's ruling party candidate Bola Tinubu was declared the winner of Nigeria's presidential election on Wednesday.

title: $33 billion fintech giant Revolut reports first-ever annual profit
description: Revolut reported revenues of £636.2 million in 2021, three times what it made the previous year, and swung to a net profit of £59.1 million.

title: 'Father of the cell phone' says one day we'll have devices embedded under our skin
description: Future generations will have devices "embedded under the skin of their ears," according to Marty Cooper, who is widely considered the father of the cell phone.

title: 'Huge uncertainty' for investors and economy as Israel's government pushes for controversial reforms
description: The right-wing governing coalition's planned legal overhaul would significantly weaken Israel's judiciary.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Most major assets fell in February, giving investors no safe haven
description: All major U.S. indexes ended February with a loss. Bonds fell too, defying their inverse relationship with stocks. And even gold dropped.

title: South Korean startup rival to Nvidia seeks $400 million valuation and plans new A.I. chip
description: Sapeon designs artificial intelligence semiconductors for data centers, for example those run by cloud computing firms.

title: China's factory activity bounces further into expansion in February
description: China's official manufacturing purchasing managers’ index rose to 52.6 in February – marking the highest reading since April 2012.

title: India says its infrastructure boost could create much-needed jobs. Economists aren't so sure
description: India's increase in infrastructure spending hopes to create more jobs to solve its unemployment problem, but economists think otherwise.

title: Being a digital nomad isn't just for singles. Here's how families make it work
description: One factor deters remote workers from choosing a nomadic lifestyle: children. Two families share how they pull it off with young kids in tow.

title: Samsung is 'working out' a roadmap for mixed reality devices as rumors of an Apple headset swirl
description: Samsung's focus on the technology comes as reports suggest Apple is gearing up to release a mixed reality headset in the spring.

title: Watch live: U.S. House China panel holds first hearing after lawmakers push seven bills targeting Beijing
description: The first hearing of the House Select Committee examining U.S. economic competition with China will focus on human rights, says Chair Rep. Mike Gallagher.
